data.title: The Wind from Nowhere by Ballard
data.meta_description: Le vent de nulle part - (The wind from nowhere) by James Graham Ballard and a great selection of related books, art and collectibles available now at AbeBooks.com.
data.text:
Softcover. Condition: Good. First Edition. Colour illustrated paperback binding with white and purple coloured titles to the front panel and back strip. Black and white photograph of author to the rear panel. Quoting from the rear panel blurb " . The wind came from nowhere . A supra-Hurricane that blasted around the globe hundreds of mph very whole communities beneath piles of rubble, destroying all organised life and driving those it did not kill to seek safety in tunnels and sewers Â where they turned against each other in their desperate struggle to survive ." Rubbing of the book edges and panels and either side of the back strip; with a very large triangular crease to the top right hand corner of the front panel. Browning of the text block edges and pages with foxing to the text edges. First Penguin Publication. Size: 12 mo (standard paperback). [6], 185, [7 Â of which for a further titles from publishing house] pages. Please refer to accompanying picture (s). Quantity Available: 1. Shipped Weight: Under 1 kilo. Category: Science Fiction & Fantasy; ISBN: 0586064303. ISBN/EAN: 9780586064306. Inventory No: 0290112.

Soft cover. Condition: Very Good. Powers, Richard (illustrator). 1st Edition. 1st printing. Mass market paperback. Berkley original #F600. Very good to near fine. Light wear at the edges, some rubbing at the base of the spine and a small 1/4 inch tear at the top of the back cover at the spine and a small nick on the back cover. Spine and cover are shinny and uncreased.

Soft cover. Condition: As New. No Jacket. Cover art by Richard Powers (illustrator). 1st Edition. Berkley Medallion mass-market paperback F823 originally priced 50 cents, as-new unread. States "Berkley Edition, September, 1963. . . . published by arrangement with the author." These nine stories including "The Man on the 99th Floor," "Thirteen to Centaurus," "Track 12," "The Thousand Dreams of Stellavista," "The Cage of Sand" and "Passport to Eternity" originally appeared -- mostly in 1962 -- in the magazines New Worlds Science Fiction, Amazing Fact and Science Fiction, Fantastic Stories, etc. Cover art by Richard Powers. 160 pp.

Hardcover. Condition: Very Good +. Dust Jacket Condition: Very Good -. This is a Book Club Edition, bound in black boards with gold lettering on the spine; top page edges tinted green. Includes the first two groundbreaking dystopian science fiction novels by English writer Ballard (1930-2009). The book is square and unmarked; corners sharp, tail of spine bumped. The dust jacket is not priced; chipped and edgeworn, with rippling and a dampstain to the back panel; Brodart protected.

Hardcover. Condition: Very Good +. Dust Jacket Condition: Very Good -. Jacket by Thomas Chibbaro (illustrator). Book Club Edition. 8 vo, 316 pp. 1965 date on title page. Black boards, with green title on spine only. Top edge also green.Corner sharp, no names, no interior markings. DUST JACKET shows wear, chipping and rubbing on all edges, back pane. Only one short tear top front Front panel illustration is undamaged. Two stories of our future foretold: when the weather takes over.

Soft cover. Condition: Near Fine. No Jacket. Cover art by Richard Powers (illustrator). Berkley Medallion mass-market paperback F823 originally priced 50 cents, appears unread but rubber-stamped "Jeff's Pacific News" with a Long Beach, California address and phone to the preliminary "Critics' Response" page, and a small round hole punched to lower right of front wrap. States "Berkley Edition, September, 1963. . . . published by arrangement with the author." These nine stories including "The Man on the 99th Floor," "Thirteen to Centaurus," "Track 12," "The Thousand Dreams of Stellavista," "The Cage of Sand" and "Passport to Eternity" originally appeared -- mostly in 1962 -- in the magazines New Worlds Science Fiction, Amazing Fact and Science Fiction, Fantastic Stories, etc. Cover art by Richard Powers. 160 pp.

Paperback. Condition: Very Good. Illustrated by Richard Powers (illustrator). 1st Paperback Edition; 1st Printing. Cover Art; First US paperback edition. This is a mass market paperback edition. Berkeley Books number F600 with price of .50cents. The book is in Very Good condition and was issued without a dust jacket. The spine ends and corners of the book covers have some light bumping, rubbing and wear. There is a small chip to the top spine end of the book covers. The text pages are generally clean, although there is some generalized toning. "The Wind from Nowhere is a science fiction novel by English author J. G. Ballard. Published in 1962, it was his debut novel. He had previously published only short stories. The novel was the first of a series of Ballard novels dealing with scenarios of natural disaster. Here, civilization is reduced to ruins by prolonged worldwide hurricane force winds. As an added dimension, Ballard explores the ways in which disaster and tragedy can bond people together in ways that no normal experiences ever could. That is another recurring theme in his works and makes one of its first appearances here. Some critics have suggested that his first four novels are based on elemental themes, showing global destruction by air, water, fire and earth. " (from Wikipedia).
